page.title: 01General description.
page.content: Situated totally in the Islwyn Borough District. The area is split centrally North to South by the Sirhowy River which drains a deep glaciated valley. The discovery of coal led to a gradual industrialisation of the district, first by levels then deep pits. Blackwood is the commercial and administrative centre. It has a thriving shopping centre, open air market and large Bus Station. Cefn Fforest developed as a village to house Britania Colliery Miners, Pontllanfraith is a strategic crossroad site, previously an important railway junction, and links both sides of the river. The decline of coal mining as the once dominent industrial as been off set by modern industrial areas bringing in replacement work.
